ThingDef.label: flightmare dragon scales
ThingDef.description: Faintly glowing, hard overlapping scales with a shiny metallic sheen. Good at cold insulation and against fire attacks. Small, and valuable, these scales can be riveted or sewn together to make all sorts of tools, furniture, clothing, and, most famously, armor. All dragon scales are fireproof, and so is anything made from them. That being said, they require a substantial quantity to craft anything, often needing ten scales for every log, steel chunk, or bit of cloth they replace.

ThingDef.label: fury dragon scales
ThingDef.description: Hard overlapping scales with a shiny metallic sheen. Exceptionally resistant to fire. Small, and valuable, these scales can be riveted or sewn together to make all sorts of tools, furniture, clothing, and, most famously, armor. All dragon scales are fireproof, and so is anything made from them. That being said, they require a substantial quantity to craft anything, often needing ten scales for every log, steel chunk, or bit of cloth they replace.

ThingDef.label: gronckle pebbles
ThingDef.description: Small, rock-like scales. Contrary to other dragon scales, Gronckle pebbles lack their distinctive shine. Durable against blunt damage. Small, and valuable, these scales can be riveted or sewn together to make all sorts of tools, furniture, clothing, and, most famously, armor. All dragon scales are fireproof, and so is anything made from them. That being said, they require a substantial quantity to craft anything, often needing ten scales for every log, steel chunk, or bit of cloth they replace.

ThingDef.label: hotburple dragon scales
ThingDef.description: Bright orange scales, hot to the touch. Durable against blunt damage. Small, and valuable, these scales can be riveted or sewn together to make all sorts of tools, furniture, clothing, and, most famously, armor. All dragon scales are fireproof, and so is anything made from them. That being said, they require a substantial quantity to craft anything, often needing ten scales for every log, steel chunk, or bit of cloth they replace.

ThingDef.label: nadder dragon scales
ThingDef.description: Hard overlapping scales with a shiny metallic sheen. Exceptionally durable in combat and against intense heat. Small, and valuable, these scales can be riveted or sewn together to make all sorts of tools, furniture, clothing, and, most famously, armor. All dragon scales are fireproof, and so is anything made from them. That being said, they require a substantial quantity to craft anything, often needing ten scales for every log, steel chunk, or bit of cloth they replace.

ThingDef.label: zippleback dragon scales
ThingDef.description: Hard overlapping scales with a shiny metallic sheen. Exceptionally durable in combat. Small, and valuable, these scales can be riveted or sewn together to make all sorts of tools, furniture, clothing, and, most famously, armor. All dragon scales are fireproof, and so is anything made from them. ThingDef.label: razorwhip dragon scales
ThingDef.description: Extremely hard overlapping scales with a shiny metallic sheen. The strongest of all dragon scales, they offer unbeatable defenses against sharp attacks. Small, and valuable, these scales can be riveted or sewn together to make all sorts of tools, furniture, clothing, and, most famously, armor. All dragon scales are fireproof, and so is anything made from them. That being said, they require a substantial quantity to craft anything, often needing ten scales for every log, steel chunk, or bit of cloth they replace.

ThingDef.label: triple stryke chitin
ThingDef.description: A chitinous substance similar to scales. Not as good at insulation as other dragon scales, but excellent in defensive capabilities. Small, and valuable, these scales can be riveted or sewn together to make all sorts of tools, furniture, clothing, and, most famously, armor. All dragon scales are fireproof, and so is anything made from them.

ThingDef.label: skrill dragon scales
ThingDef.description: Hard overlapping scales with a shiny metallic sheen. Exceptionally durable in combat. Small, and valuable, these scales can be riveted or sewn together to make all sorts of tools, furniture, clothing, and, most famously, armor. All dragon scales are fireproof, and so is anything made from them. That being said, they require a substantial quantity to craft anything, often needing ten scales for every log, steel chunk, or bit of cloth they replace.

ThingDef.label: mixed dragonscales
ThingDef.description: A weak dragonscale textile created by cutting up and sewing together various types of dragonscales. Small, and valuable, these scales can be riveted or sewn together to make all sorts of tools, furniture, clothing, and, most famously, armor. All dragon scales are fireproof, and so is anything made from them. That being said, they require a substantial quantity to craft anything, often needing ten scales for every log, steel chunk, or bit of cloth they replace.
